Name: Auspex/Scanner
Effect: Detects motion, energy emissions, light outside of human vision, signs of life, and more within Medium Range. Requires a Tech Test to detect specific phenomena or overcome interference.

Name: Auto-Quill
Effect: Transcribes spoken words or copies written text onto parchment, allowing for quick and accurate record-keeping.

Name: Chirurgeon’s Kit (5 uses)
Effect: A Chirurgeon's Kit is required to treat many Critical Wounds as well as certain Injuries. A Chirurgeon's Kit is also required to gain the benefits of the Chirurgeon Talent. You can use the Chirurgeon's Kit five times before it must be replenished. The cost to replenish the Chirurgeon's Kit is equal to half the cost of a Chirurgeons Kit based on its availability. You may expend one use of the kit to remove a Bleeding Condition not gained from a Critical Wound with a Easy (+40) Medicae Test. Using the Chirurgeon's Kit to treat a wound or injury, or to remove a Poisoned Condition, also requires a Medicae Test. Unless stated otherwise, the Difficulty of the Test is Challenging (+0). On a failure, one use of the supplies is consumed to no effect.

Name: Chrono
Effect: Displays the current time and automatically adjusts to local time after a few seconds on the ground.

Name: Climbing Harness
Effect: A climbing harness line is 50 metres in length and can support the weight of a Medium-sized creature or object. It takes an Action to set up a climbing harness. Additionally, the harness automatically arrests its payload should it detect the user falling too fast.

Name: Combi-Tool
Effect: Contains probes, blades, and other tools to appease Machine Spirits and awaken slumbering ones.

Name: Comm Leech
Effect: Can be used to make a Challenging (+0) Tech Test to intercept electronic signals out to 3 miles, with the GM making the final determination of Test Difficulty and distance based on the current circumstances. Can intercept messages a number of minutes long equal to the SL. On a failure, the leech attempt is detected by the transmitter.

Name: Dataslate
Effect: Can be used to interface with many machines by making a Routine (+20) Tech Test, though obscure or well-protected machinery might require a more difficult Test, or may simply lack the necessary interfaces entirely. A Dataslate can store and display multiple text data, picts, and vid files. Each can be locked with a biometric password, requiring a Hard (−20) Tech Test to bypass.

Name: Diagnostor
Effect: Identifies ailments in humans, used with Medicae and Perception Tests to reveal illnesses or diseases.

Name: Disguise Kit
Effect: Alters appearance to fool guards and pict scanners, requiring a Challenging (+0) or harder Dexterity Test for complex disguises.

Name: Emperor’s Tarot
Effect: Once per session, allows divination of the future, requiring a Difficult (-10) Discipline Test and one hour. Fate cannot be spent to alter the results of the Test. +2 SL or more gives glimpses of a promising future, recovering 1 Fate point. -2 SL or more loses 1 Fate point due to ill omens. Fumble burns one Fate point.

Name: Entrenching Tool
Effect: Digging tool that can also be used as an Improvised (One-handed) melee weapon, or counting instead as an Axe if properly sharpened.

Name: Excruciator Kit
Effect: Extracts information from unwilling prisoners, used with Presence (Interrogation) Tests.

Name: Glow-Globe/Stablight
Effect: Provides illumination for 5 hours, removing Poorly Lit and Dark Traits from your Zone. Takes 2 hours of non-use to recharge, or almost instantly if connected to a standard Imperial power source.

Name: Grapnel Launcher
Effect: Combines a Climbing Harness with a pistol-like launcher that fires a magnetic hook on a line. The Grapnel Launcher can reach 50 metres and, once affixed, can lift two Medium-sized creatures or objects at a rate of 5 metres per round. Using the Grapnel Launcher is an Action, and requires an Routine (+20) Ranged (Pistols) Test.

Name: Grav Chute
Effect: While active, allows controlled descent from heights, ignoring falling damage for 10 minutes before needing recharge. Recharging is done by connecting to a standard Imperial power supply for 10 hours.

Name: Holy Icon
Effect: Grants +1 SL to Discipline (Fear) Tests for characters with sufficient faith.

Name: Inhaler/Injector
Effect: Administers medication or stimulants quickly and effectively.

Name: Instruments of Divination
Effect: Aids in divination, with effects depending on the psyker’s power and influence.

Name: Lascutter
Effect: Cuts through solid objects like bulkheads and vault doors, requiring a Tech (Engineering) Test. Can be used as a Improvised (One-handed) weapon with Inflict (Ablaze), Loud, Rend(3).

Name: Laud Hailer
Effect: Amplifies voice or sounds to be heard above crowds up to 100 meters away.

Name: Mag Boots
Effect: As an Action, can be activated to stick to a ferromagnetic surface. This allows ignoring the effects of zero or low gravity, but one's Speed is reduced to Slow. In normal gravity, can make a Challenging (+0) Athletics (Climbing) or Reflexes (Acrobatics) Test to walk on metallic walls and ceilings. Speed is Slow when doing so.

Name: Magnoculars
Effect: Amplifies visual images, can be used in combination with Awareness (Sight) Tests to detect objects at Long Range or further.

Name: Manacles
Effect: Restrains prisoners, requiring a Very Hard (-30) Dexterity (Lock Picking), Athletics (Might) or Tech (Security) Test to unlock without the key. This Test is made with Disadvantage if the user is attempting to unlock themself. Can be destroyed by dealing 10 Damage to them.

Name: Micro-Bead/Vox Bead
Effect: Allows discreet communication within a mile, though dense obstructions may disrupt the signal.

Name: Monotask Servo-Skull
Effect: Provides specific abilities like illumination, amplification, medical aid, scanning, or utility tasks.

Name: Multicompass
Effect: Aids in navigation and exploration, employing sensors and gyroscopic cogitators to signal axial and magnetic north. Can be used in combination with Navigation (Surface) or other Tests relating to making one's way across unfamiliar terrain.

Name: Multikey
Effect: Bypasses locks of Imperial design, requiring a Dexterity (Lock Picking) Test.

Name: Pict Recorder
Effect: Records and stores hundreds of images and roughly 10 hours of video. Operating a handheld Pict Recorder requires an Action for each round it is in use, but does not require a Test.

Name: Psy Focus
Effect: Grants +1 SL to Psychic Mastery Tests, aiding in accessing the powers of the Warp.

Name: Regicide Set
Effect: A board game of strategy and cunning, useful for social interactions.

Name: Sacred Unguents (5 uses)
Effect: Calms Machine Spirits, aiding in maintenance and repair of Imperial technological items. As an Action, make a Challenging (+0) Tech (Engineering) Test to apply the Unguents. If successful, re-roll next failed Test using said item. Unguents dry up after one re-roll or if one day passes. Failing the test to apply the Sacred Unguents still uses one charge.

Name: Screamer
Effect: Sets off alarms when detecting movement, sound, or pressure, requiring a Routine (+20) Tech (Security) Test to set. On failure, the Screamer goes off and alerts everyone within Long Range.

Name: Signal Jammer
Effect: Disrupts vox and data transmissions within 1 kilometer, preventing communication. If not connected to a power source, a jammer can operate for 2 hours before its battery is depleted.

Name: Stummer
Effect: Cancels ambient noise, increasing the Difficulty of sonic Awareness Tests in the same Zone by three steps. Its power lasts for 20 minutes; recharging takes several minutes with a standard Imperial power source.

Name: Vox-Caster
Effect: Allows voice transmission to other Vox-Casters and Vox Beads within 100 kilometers.

Name: Writing Kit
Effect: Contains parchment, quills, ink, and other items for recording information in areas with unreliable technology.

Name: Bio-sample Extractor
Effect: Extracts and analyzes biological samples (flesh, blood, pheromones) with a Challenging (+0) Tech (Security) Test. Functions as an auspex for target tracing.

Name: Consecrated Scrolls
Effect: Consecrated Scrolls, blessed with holy substances and inscriptions, aid psykers by allowing a reroll on Psychic Phenomena or Perils of the Warp tables. This action destroys the scroll. Requires personal crafting and crumbles upon absorbing Warp energy.

Name: Liber Heresius/Inquisitorial Tome
Effect: Armored tome of Inquisition knowledge, unique to each, detailing cults, tactics, and schemes. Reading it as an Endeavour grants Advantage on related knowledge Tests and halves the XP cost of the first Lore (Forbidden), Rapport (Inquiry), or Presence (Interrogation) Skill/Specialisation Advance. Provides 'Know Thy Foe' Superiority gauging against a specific cult once.

Name: Listening Vox
Effect: Compact, long-range audio recorder/transmitter. Records within a Zone, transmits up to 100 miles (requires paired Vox Caster/Cogitator). Battery lasts 24 hours. Concealment advised. Signal can be jammed; detectable by Auspex with an Hard (-20) Tech (Security) Test.

Name: Polymorphine
Effect: Exotic shapeshifting drug. Trained Callidus Assassins can mimic various forms, including xenos; untrained users are limited to Humans. Transformation takes 1d5 Rounds and a Challenging (+0) Fortitude (Endurance) Test. Failure results in Fatigued condition for 30 minutes. Success lasts up to 2 hours, granting Advantage on disguise-related Tests.

Name: Soulguilt Scanner
Effect: Investigative tool combining conventional (pheromone sniffers, brain activity scanners) and esoteric (Warp emanation reading) instruments. Identifies threats by detecting 'warbling resonance' around impure minds. Grants +2 SL on Awareness and Intuition Tests for hunting malcontents, heretics, or criminals.

Name: Adeptus Administratum Forms
Effect: Contains standard Adeptus Administratum forms, from licences to requisitions. Having pre-filled forms may grant narrative advantages or serve as props to confuse those outside the Administratum.

Name: Administratum Seal and Notary Kit
Effect: Allows proper sealing and notarisation of Administratum documents. Without it, paperwork may be lost or rejected. Often personalised for higher officials.

Name: Adeptus Administratum Sigil of Office
Effect: Represents official rank within the Administratum. Grants +1 SL on Fellowship Tests with characters impressed by such an object.

Name: Archaeo-auspex
Effect: Reveals ancient energy emissions or radiation. Using it as an Action may reveal hidden technology or lost sites. Requires a Tech (Engineering) Test to interpret or overcome interference.

Name: Infantryman’s Grooming Kit
Effect: Standard-issue hygiene kit containing basic grooming items. Provides +1 SL on Presence or Rapport Tests when appearance matters.

Name: Locator Beacon
Effect: Emits a signal locatable by auspex or vehicle scanners. Typical range: Long. Mastercrafted versions reach Extreme Range or planetary scale. Requires a Challenging (+0) Tech (Security) Test to activate.

Name: Microfauna Inhibitor Spray
Effect: Repels insect life. Each container provides five applications lasting ~2 hours. Grants Advantage on Tests to resist Environmental Hazards tied to microfauna. Bearer suffers Disadvantage on Awareness (Smell, Taste).

Name: Munitorum Grade-5 Adhesion Tape
Effect: Durable adhesive tape usable for sealing, repairs, or strapping. Requires 2 Damage or a Difficult (–10) Athletics Test to break. Holds up to Encumbrance 2 effectively.

Name: Personal Cogitator
Effect: Portable cogitator for field tasks. Allows a Challenging (+0) Tech Test every 5 minutes to undertake calculations or programming. May link to devices like auspex for data.

Name: Salvation Augur
Effect: Detects toxic or radiological hazards. Emits alarms, colour changes, or vibrations. No Test required for basic detection. Tech (+20) Test may reveal exact concentration and nature of hazard.

Name: Survey Augur
Effect: Geophysical scanner for measuring material density. Provides detailed scans of a Zone with a Challenging (+0) Tech Test. Grants Advantage to allies’ ranged attacks against targets in the scanned Zone.

Name: Tactical Hololith Table
Effect: Projects 3D tactical maps. Grants Advantage on Tests to Know Thy Battlefield when gaining Superiority before an encounter.

Name: Trip-augur
Effect: Small security devices sensing motion. Can be linked to vox devices to send alarms when triggered. Sensitive enough to estimate approximate intruder numbers.

Name: Veriscant Multi-lens Array
Effect: Multi-lens array granting +1 SL on Awareness (Sight), Intuition (Surroundings), or Logic (Investigation) Tests. Ignores penalties from Dark or Poorly Lit Zones.

Name: Void Breach Kit
Effect: Emergency kit for sealing hull breaches. Requires a Challenging (+0) Dexterity Test to use. Success seals breaches for hours depending on conditions.

Name: Weapon Maintenance Kit
Effect: Contains cleaning agents, lubricants, and repair tools. A Routine (+20) Tech (Engineering) Test restores a weapon, removing the effects of the first Fumble rolled while it is being used.
